af6b9f9e-a859-4e0c-9b86-aa0f42029e2b.description: Do you ever feel like you are lost in space in your own classroom, looking for evidence of intelligent life? Workshop participants explore their current practices in the classroom that encourage critical thinking skills. After watching videos of and participating in hands-on examples of critical thinking exercises, workshop participants create their own exercises to ensure higher-level critical thinking among their students.
af6b9f9e-a859-4e0c-9b86-aa0f42029e2b.name: Searching for Tangible Evidence of Critical Thinking Skills

issuer.summary: issued by National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

entity.name: National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

af85c778-60f2-4665-8db8-4bda4cd9a92d.description: Presenters at NISOD’s International Conference on Teaching and Leadership Excellence lead thought-provoking sessions designed specifically for community and technical college educators committed to improving student achievement.
af85c778-60f2-4665-8db8-4bda4cd9a92d.name: Virtual International Conference on Teaching and Leadership Excellence Presenter

issuer.summary: issued by National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

entity.name: National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

badge_template_activities.title: Present a session at NISOD's Virtual Annual Conference.

db6807ca-569e-46ae-9306-0220918b9d86.description: During this multidimensional, highly-interactive, experiential, and fun workshop, participants explore ways to promote positive, enthusiastic, and engaged collaboration among students. They also explore how to encourage student learning in a manner that maximizes motivation, a sense of inclusion, and equity within the learning environment!
db6807ca-569e-46ae-9306-0220918b9d86.name: Emotional Intelligence, Student Efficacy, and the Growth Mindset

issuer.summary: issued by National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

entity.name: National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

6f30ba56-f41d-4107-87f6-bbcf5de4953f.description: During this two-part workshop, participants practice a series of exercises that can be used in remote teaching to engage students in interactive learning and exploration. The workshop helps faculty build a sense of community within the classroom and emphasizes dialogic approaches to teaching the whole student and engaged learning. Participants gain hands-on experience practicing the exercises and leave the workshop ready to bring new approaches back to the classroom.
6f30ba56-f41d-4107-87f6-bbcf5de4953f.name: Multiple Pathways to the Student Brain: Science and Strategies to Energize and Enhance Instruction

issuer.summary: issued by National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

entity.name: National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

49e9d3d8-f699-4fbc-97f4-d39c924e14a7.description: When first entering a community college classroom, many faculty members are shocked that students don’t act like “adults.” Even seasoned faculty members are sometimes flabbergasted by students’ behavior. Workshop participants gain a new perspective on student behavior, why students behave in certain ways, and how to respond to unprofessional classroom behavior.
49e9d3d8-f699-4fbc-97f4-d39c924e14a7.name: How to Manage Student Behavior Without Really Trying

issuer.summary: issued by National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

entity.name: National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

4de16431-119b-400d-8d0d-8ea1497a939b.description: This workshop highlights how instructors, through their actions, communicate their character, credibility, and convictions. To be an effective instructor, educators must learn how to connect with their students. Participants learn new perspectives, practical tools, and key takeaways crucial to the skill of connecting and return to their classrooms ready to implement new action plans and lead with renewed passion and commitment.
4de16431-119b-400d-8d0d-8ea1497a939b.name: Everyone Communicates, but Few Connect: Effectively Engaging Today's Learner

issuer.summary: issued by National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

entity.name: National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

skills.name: Relate To All Types Of Students

ca78efcb-04fc-4742-8604-5eeaec923194.description: Millennials are not the younger generation in our classrooms; they’ve been followed by Gen Z students. Students have changed, and so must our classrooms and teaching strategies. Faculty should understand that there are differences between Gen Y and Gen Z students, and that new ways are needed to respond to, communicate with, and motivate Gen Z students. Workshop participants learn how to engage Gen Z students using free and easy-to-use educational technology tools.
ca78efcb-04fc-4742-8604-5eeaec923194.name: Another New Paradigm: The MillennialZ and Educational Technology

issuer.summary: issued by National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

entity.name: National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

2a2b3d96-c73d-4c26-9ee4-f0e0ef7b65b6.description: This workshop provides participants with concrete tools for teaching rationality and critical thinking skills in Science and Mathematics courses. By the end of the workshop, participants are able to help students be more rational, deploy scientific and mathematical thinking more consistently, and recognize reasoning errors that can be corrected with scientific and mathematical reasoning. Instructors will understand rationality, mindware, gaps in mindware, and recognize contaminated mindware.
2a2b3d96-c73d-4c26-9ee4-f0e0ef7b65b6.name: Teaching Critical Thinking and Rationality in Science and Math Courses

issuer.summary: issued by National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

entity.name: National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

5eff6fa9-1bfb-4b21-a901-955edce1e02d.description: NISOD's Conference Proposal Committee is a group of 15-20 skilled, strategic thinkers chosen to review proposals for NISOD's 2023 Annual Conference. These volunteers have the privilege of developing a keen understanding of how sessions are rated as well as having direct influence over which topics will be included in the conference program.
5eff6fa9-1bfb-4b21-a901-955edce1e02d.name: 2023 Annual Conference Proposal Reviewer

issuer.summary: issued by National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

entity.name: National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

7520abe0-fa27-4bc8-87d1-58f2ebb3845b.description: The facilitator explores how participants of all backgrounds can feel safe engaging in the conversation, bringing their whole selves to work, and making positive changes so everyone in the organization feels valued and included. This workshop helps participants meet important needs that all organizations share: Improving employee inclusion, and mitigating the risk of negative consequences such as decreased employee morale, high turnover rates, and conflict in the workplace.
7520abe0-fa27-4bc8-87d1-58f2ebb3845b.name: Another Seat at the Table: A Diversity and Inclusion Workshop (Part 1)

issuer.summary: issued by National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

entity.name: National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

badge_template_activities.title: Complete Another Seat at the Table: A Diversity and Inclusion Workshop (Part 1)

bc4e6a42-cfc9-4be4-9553-f5987f3553d1.description: There’s no doubt that the past two years have been challenging for students and faculty alike. In this webinar, the presenters demonstrate socially distanced ways for you and your students to continue working together to learn and apply course content through various free technologies. The presenters cover Google Slides, Poll Everywhere, virtual escape rooms, H5P, breakout rooms, Group me, and more. 0.1 Continuing Education Units (CEUs).
bc4e6a42-cfc9-4be4-9553-f5987f3553d1.name: Useful Technology to Enhance Collaboration in Your Post-Pandemic Courses

issuer.summary: issued by National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

entity.name: National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

alignments.name: Learning Outcomes
alignments.description: 1. Participants learn to create classroom activities that engage students in collaboration yet maintain safety protocols. 2. Participants can describe at least five different free technologies that can be implemented in the classroom. 3. Participants gain hands-on experience with at least two of the demonstrated technologies during the session.

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully pass webinar learning assessment with 80% score or higher.

daec4ea3-735c-4a56-bc9e-f2fae9786e53.description: This webinar provides an understanding of the issues students face in a peri-post pandemic period. The facilitator shares a foundation of terms and topics that assist educators at all levels create a welcoming and safe classroom for students to help promote attendance, learning, and self-awareness. The facilitator provides a list of ways in which the participants can create a safe space and where or how they can intervene in difficult situations.
daec4ea3-735c-4a56-bc9e-f2fae9786e53.name: Embracing the Issues of a Typical Student to Create a Welcoming Classroom

issuer.summary: issued by National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

entity.name: National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

alignments.name: Learning Outcomes
alignments.description: Understand and define mental health and mental illness. Learn how to establish a safe-space classroom. Understand what a crisis is and who can develop crises. Learn how educators can help students dealing with mental health, mental illness, or crises.

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully pass webinar learning assessment with 80% score or higher.

b17d62ac-9ca4-4ca9-9e9e-45e8d2c193bb.description: Instructors set the tone in the classroom by how they approach their work and students. Through their actions, they communicate their character, credibility, and convictions. Today’s students need to be convinced about their instructor’s passion before they put passion into their own work. To be an effective instructor, you must learn how to connect with your students.
b17d62ac-9ca4-4ca9-9e9e-45e8d2c193bb.name: Everyone Communicates, But Few Connect: Effectively Engaging Today’s Learner

issuer.summary: issued by National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

entity.name: National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

059702c4-3799-4c02-9f59-91fc367ac7f0.description: Mental health issues are becoming a crisis in education due to the effects of the pandemic. In addition to impairing physical health, anxiety, stress, and trauma make it harder for students to do higher-order thinking, focus, regulate emotions, get to class, budget time, and complete projects. But you can help! Workshop participants learn how to reduce these obstacles to achievement, whether they’re teaching in-person or online.
059702c4-3799-4c02-9f59-91fc367ac7f0.name: The Hidden Learning Disability of Anxiety, Stress, and Trauma: Science and Strategies for Improved Learning

issuer.summary: issued by National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

entity.name: National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

skills.name: Mental Health Support In The Classroom

0ce4ae60-b00a-4857-b90d-576541196cb3.description: Are you struggling to regulate your emotions or experiencing sleep disturbances? These behaviors are normal reactions to high stress and trauma. Unfortunately, it’s easy for your brain to form pathways in response to anxiety, stress, and trauma. The more these pathways fire, the more likely they are to fire again and become “hardwired.” During this two-part workshop, participants learn the science behind how stress affects them and actions that can be taken to effectively address it.
0ce4ae60-b00a-4857-b90d-576541196cb3.name: Addressing Faculty Anxiety

issuer.summary: issued by National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

entity.name: National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

45854f79-ac8f-4723-8dd4-ed486a4ccb8c.description: Effective online teaching combines rigorous course design with support strategies for remote learners. It is critical that faculty members and faculty leaders know about effective course design and instructional practices that help online students achieve their academic goals. Sessions presented during this convening inform online teaching and learning policies and practices that ensure remote students receive the most effective educational experience possible.
45854f79-ac8f-4723-8dd4-ed486a4ccb8c.name: Effective Online Teaching Practices

issuer.summary: issued by National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

entity.name: National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

badge_template_activities.title: Present at NISOD's "Effective Online Teaching Practices" Online Convening.

1ba33ce7-0c95-476d-818a-ff59f5f0fd58.description: The contemporary challenges community college leaders face are increasingly complex and must be addressed with a new approach to leadership. They require an adaptive leader equipped with a unique set of strategies, including: Engaging in critical self-reflection; tailoring communication; dissociating from the problem; listening to diverse perspectives; managing emotional responses with sensitivity; empowering those who are change-averse; and challenging assumptions with data. 0.1 CEUs.
1ba33ce7-0c95-476d-818a-ff59f5f0fd58.name: Pandemics, Politics, and People: The Adaptive Skills Community College Leaders Need to Meet Today’s Challenges

issuer.summary: issued by National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

entity.name: National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

alignments.name: Learning Outcomes
alignments.description: Participants define adaptive leadership and applications to community college leadership. Participants analyze case studies and evaluate which strategies would be best used to resolve the adaptive challenges presented. Participants apply the concept of adaptive leadership and its related practices to their own work contexts at community colleges.

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully pass webinar learning assessment with 80% score or higher.

91a9ae39-f108-4db1-978b-e342df1c21c9.description: This workshop helps new and experienced online instructors understand the features of online practice that contribute to teacher burnout. Participants learn about specific, actionable strategies for reducing their workload without sacrificing student engagement and success.
91a9ae39-f108-4db1-978b-e342df1c21c9.name: Emergence, Not Exhaustion: Sustainable Teaching in Online Environments

issuer.summary: issued by National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

entity.name: National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

fae806a2-07e3-4722-bb03-b0e626ea2e4e.description: Community colleges nationwide are experiencing increased enrollment of African American and Latino students. At the same time, these students graduate and transfer at significantly lower rates than their White counterparts. This disparity points to a need to teach and reach marginalized populations more effectively. This webinar elaborates on five ways educators can use restorative and culturally responsive teaching practices to reduce opportunity gaps for Black and Brown students.
fae806a2-07e3-4722-bb03-b0e626ea2e4e.name: Five Strategies for Teaching and Reaching African American and Latino Students

issuer.summary: issued by National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

entity.name: National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

alignments.name: Learning Outcomes
alignments.description: Participants know or will be able to examine how our own stories inform our biases and how we respond/not respond to students, examine national enrollment and completion trends for community college students in order to understand the importance of centering race, and explore strategies for making the classroom a more inclusive space.

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully pass webinar learning assessment with 80% score or higher.

507b1172-08db-47e0-b01b-0bedbc701ab5.description: All colleges seek to create an equitable, diverse, and inclusive community for their students, faculty, staff, and alumni. However, much work remains to be done. Sessions presented during this convening facilitate conversations about specific initiatives that can be taken to advance equity, diversity, and inclusion by removing obstacles to equal participation for everyone at community and technical colleges.
507b1172-08db-47e0-b01b-0bedbc701ab5.name: Improving Equity, Diversity, and Inclusion

issuer.summary: issued by National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

entity.name: National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

badge_template_activities.title: Present a session at the Improving Equity, Diversity, and Inclusion Online Convening

8eb9c7b0-1490-4e3b-b6b8-c8459c925708.description: This webinar provides tools and techniques to assist distance educators. The presenters explore how being prepared and professional as educators leads to success with students, fosters effective teaching practices by improving attitudes and emotions, and develops students as professionals. Prepared educators consider the teaching environment, the materials, their students, and themselves. 0.1 CEUs.
8eb9c7b0-1490-4e3b-b6b8-c8459c925708.name: Prepared, Personal and Professional: Maximizing Your Impact on Student Engagement

issuer.summary: issued by National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

entity.name: National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

alignments.name: Learning Outcomes
alignments.description: Participants will be able to compare the difference between being prepared from a content standard as opposed to being prepared to personally meet student needs. Participants will be able to explain the importance of character in being a professional educator.

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully pass webinar learning assessment with 80% score or higher.

688c6132-79ce-4363-954a-a6c949215a5f.description: In the summer of 2020, we investigated what our two-year colleagues had done to cope with the stress of teaching during the pandemic. We followed up with our colleagues this past fall to investigate their ongoing experience. This webinar presents what was learned and offers recommendations for navigating what lies ahead, including specific skills to help cope with the stress of professional roles at community and technical colleges. 0.1 Continuing Education Units (CEUs).
688c6132-79ce-4363-954a-a6c949215a5f.name: Pandemic Pivot: The Faculty Experience after Two Years of Challenge

issuer.summary: issued by National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

entity.name: National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

alignments.name: Learning Outcomes
alignments.description: 1. Participants can meaningfully reflect on their own pandemic pivot. 2. Participants can describe the risks of burnout they might experience on their own campuses. 3. Participants can list three specific skills to help them cope with the stress of their professional roles.

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully pass webinar learning assessment with 80% score or higher.

d0aa263b-60e2-482a-901c-c310094a3c3e.description: This workshop provides participants with specific tools for teaching critical thinking skills in pre-college English courses. The facilitator provides proven methodologies to enhance critical thinking skills while teaching basic English writing and comprehension. By the end of the workshop, participants can better prepare students for transfer-level English courses and increase their critical thinking skills.
d0aa263b-60e2-482a-901c-c310094a3c3e.name: Teaching Critical Thinking in Pre-College English Courses

4c2339a7-a298-4742-810b-3db4869bf005.description: With the advent of new technologies that make teaching via live, online (a.k.a. synchronous) sessions easier and more accessible, learning how to facilitate these types of sessions is a critical skill for all educators. Most of us have attended an online class, presentation, or webinar that was just plain boring. During this workshop, participants do some major boredom-busting! Are you ready to create and facilitate sessions that leave your learners wanting more?
4c2339a7-a298-4742-810b-3db4869bf005.name: No More Boring Online Classes: Creating Exciting, Engaging, and Effective Live Sessions

issuer.summary: issued by National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

d7b10221-2239-4c36-bf97-f9783f78b484.description: The Online Student Support Symposium is designed for practitioners who support community and technical college students. The Symposium will provide an opportunity to learn best practices from leaders in the field and engage with other professionals committed to supporting students.
d7b10221-2239-4c36-bf97-f9783f78b484.name: Online Student Support Symposium

issuer.summary: issued by National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

entity.name: National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

badge_template_activities.title: Conducted a one-hour presentation through Zoom.

691aeafd-8ecb-4792-8b5f-bf9420bcc9f2.description: Food and housing insecurities can have huge psychological and academic effects on students, including poor physical and mental health and a decrease in completion, persistence, and credit attainment rates. Sessions presented during this convening provide strategies and practices faculty members can use to alleviate students’ food and housing insecurities and advance their academic success.
691aeafd-8ecb-4792-8b5f-bf9420bcc9f2.name: Overcoming Food and Housing Insecurities

issuer.summary: issued by National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

c8411d17-46db-4ca6-8569-b034978f1b24.description: Faculty professional learning is of growing interest as one way to support the increasingly complex skills students need to learn as they complete their academic pursuits and move into the 21st-century workforce. Sessions presented during this convening share initiatives that are effective in improving faculty instructional practices and student learning.
c8411d17-46db-4ca6-8569-b034978f1b24.name: Successful Faculty Professional Development Models

issuer.summary: issued by National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

45f8ff33-ab54-42a2-a095-8750ffff578b.description: Participants in the Online Professional Development Symposium learn about programs and activities designed for full- and part-time faculty and staff development, including best practices and tools they can bring back and apply at their institution.
45f8ff33-ab54-42a2-a095-8750ffff578b.name: Online Professional Development Symposium

issuer.summary: issued by National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

3140b5f8-5830-4d31-8b51-60a9bccafa88.description: Networking has a bad rap, and many faculty miss vital professional growth and mentoring opportunities as a result. During this webinar, the presenter shares a more accurate and beneficial view of networking, shows why faculty and staff should engage in networking opportunities, and briefly explains approaches and tools to foster connections. Participants leave with a practical plan for making connections while benefiting themselves and others.
3140b5f8-5830-4d31-8b51-60a9bccafa88.name: Why Should I Network When I Already Have a Job?

issuer.summary: issued by National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

entity.name: National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

alignments.name: Learning Outcomes
alignments.description: Reduce or eliminate your reluctance to approach colleagues that you do not already know. Identify the most effective attitudes and approaches to networking for academics. Set up or improve a professional LinkedIn profile that will foster connections with other professionals. Identify mutually profitable connections.

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully pass webinar learning assessment with 80% score or higher.

fcdbd947-3bd1-4fcf-896c-79b1e7c88b18.description: This webinar provides tools and techniques for communicating with students in digital environments. The presenters explore how to understand your students’ communication needs, the use of messages to facilitate supportive contact, essential communication tools, and how to make a distance relationship successful. The importance of tone and verbiage in emails; using real time communication aids (Zoom, FaceTime, etc.); communicating in a timely fashion; accuracy in instructional messages. 0.1 CEUs.
fcdbd947-3bd1-4fcf-896c-79b1e7c88b18.name: Connecting Through Communications at a Distance

issuer.summary: issued by National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

entity.name: National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

alignments.name: Learning Outcomes
alignments.description: Identify the unique communication needs of students in a distance learning environment. Discuss the importance of communication in distance learning. Apply effective communication skills in distance environments.

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully pass webinar learning assessment with 80% score or higher.

6c53bdf1-5b86-41ae-84a2-a5c16d42b3d0.description: Workshop participants examine their own practices and learn what they can do to encourage critical-thinking skills. After watching videos of and participating in hands-on examples of critical-thinking exercises, workshop participants create their own exercises to ensure higher-level critical-thinking in their online students.
6c53bdf1-5b86-41ae-84a2-a5c16d42b3d0.name: Is There Intelligent Life Online? Searching for Tangible Evidence of Critical-Thinking Skills

By the end of the workshop, participants are able to create lesson plans that enhance critical thinking skills based on content from any discipline in the humanities or social sciences. Participants will also learn how these skills can be easily and accurately measured.

Improve Writing Skills Based On Critical Thinking Practices

An emphasis is placed on using the tools in Humanities and Social Sciences classes to improve students’ reading and writing skills.
7c7a279e-23a0-4232-9f5b-bbf755d8bf2a.name: Teaching Critical Thinking Online

bf5b3f2c-5610-4938-8e25-bee82b88a07e.description: When teaching online, instructors have an important role in supporting and ensuring the success of students—especially deaf students. This webinar offers tips to take into consideration when designing online courses and virtual campus activities. Participants learn how to integrate accommodations into virtual learning environments as well as inclusive student engagement practices to help reduce or remove barriers.
bf5b3f2c-5610-4938-8e25-bee82b88a07e.name: Creating Inclusive Virtual Learning Environments for Deaf Students

Construct at least one learning activity that increases deaf students’ ability to engage and interact equitably with peers and faculty. Formulate two to three universal design or inclusive practices for creating equitable learning opportunities for all students.

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully pass webinar learning assessment with 80% score or higher.

7ec8de5b-44fe-4e1c-a403-662ce82bc956.description: Food and housing insecurities can have huge psychological and academic effects on students, including poor physical and mental health and a decrease in completion, persistence, and credit attainment rates. Sessions presented during this convening provide strategies and practices faculty members can use to alleviate students’ food and housing insecurities and advance their academic success.
7ec8de5b-44fe-4e1c-a403-662ce82bc956.name: Overcoming Food and Housing Insecurities

issuer.summary: issued by National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

entity.name: National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

badge_template_activities.title: Facilitate a session of the Overcoming Food and Housing Insecurities  Online Convening.

935adb8b-e6b2-44e3-8a64-c83a59334599.description: This workshop explores how Conversation Design and Artificial Intelligence Technology will impact tomorrow’s classrooms. During the workshop, participants delve into the various aspects of AI and Conversational Design and consider how these power elements influence the creation of learning content and learning experiences.sample
935adb8b-e6b2-44e3-8a64-c83a59334599.name: The Age of Artificial Intelligence and Learning

2899864b-c68f-45e2-916b-c8aba6d183e3.description: Reading Apprenticeship is an instructional model that provides students with resources for approaching complex texts more confidently and strategically by engaging their instructors in a dynamic professional development process of making their thinking visible. This workshop engages STEM participants in metacognitive conversations centered on complex disciplinary texts that defeat many students.
2899864b-c68f-45e2-916b-c8aba6d183e3.name: Deeper STEM Learning Through Metacognitive Conversations

083bc506-39a1-4fe2-b5e5-7cb1d5c8fb2c.description: Effective online teaching combines rigorous course design with support strategies for remote learners. It is critical that faculty members and faculty leaders know about effective course design and instructional practices that help online students achieve their academic goals. Sessions presented during this convening inform online teaching and learning policies and practices that ensure remote students receive the most effective educational experience possible.
083bc506-39a1-4fe2-b5e5-7cb1d5c8fb2c.name: Effective Online Teaching Practices

issuer.summary: issued by National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

entity.name: National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

ab1de311-b703-4c6b-bc23-f98e09a9cc88.description: The Online Classified Staff Symposium consists of presentations designed specifically for community and technical college classified staff. Classified staff can network with support employees at other colleges as they learn about topics that will help them grow professionally and personally.
ab1de311-b703-4c6b-bc23-f98e09a9cc88.name: Online Classified Staff Symposium

issuer.summary: issued by National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

badge_template_activities.title: Conducted two one-hour presentations to 50 participants through Zoom.

c238064a-04bc-4ad6-b963-4ace9bb92cbc.description: Faculty professional learning is of growing interest as one way to support the increasingly complex skills students need to learn as they complete their academic pursuits and move into the 21st-century workforce. Sessions presented during this convening share initiatives that are effective in improving faculty instructional practices and student learning.
c238064a-04bc-4ad6-b963-4ace9bb92cbc.name: Successful Faculty Professional Development Models

5abb9d01-a845-4754-832a-893d23cf98e5.description: In an era in which all faculty members should all be prepared to teach in a virtual environment, we need tools to effectively and efficiently instruct, monitor, motivate, captivate, and assess our students beyond what our LMS may provide. The purpose of this three-part workshop is to expose faculty members to websites and apps that can be used to increase student engagement and achievement in virtual and face-to-face classrooms.
5abb9d01-a845-4754-832a-893d23cf98e5.name: Beyond the LMS: Using Free Digital Learning and Teaching Tools in the COVID Age

issuer.summary: issued by National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

a3aae233-75b4-450e-a8eb-d9e837b92bb9.description: Our traditional systems of grading tend to reward behavior rather than knowledge, to be demotivating, and to demand that instructors perform endless workarounds to improve student outcomes. In this webinar, the presenters introduce an approach to grading that aims to equitably assess student learning and motivate student persistence. Presenters share details about grading strategies, preliminary results, and lessons learned from the implementation. T
a3aae233-75b4-450e-a8eb-d9e837b92bb9.name: First, Do No Harm: Equitable Grading Practices That Support Mastery

issuer.summary: issued by National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

entity.name: National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

badge_template_activities.title: Complete post-workshop evaluation and score 80% or higher on the learning assessment.

46f3057c-ede6-4fc0-b37e-3e56b1f6a401.description: This webinar provides individuals with a wide range of strategies and techniques to help promote student engagement in the classroom and online. Strategies include ideas for relationship-building, personalization of learning, content connections, and technology integration. Presenters share personal experiences and success stories from their combined 35+ years of teaching at-risk, low-performing, and unmotivated students at the K-12 and collegiate levels. Individuals leave the webinar with multi
46f3057c-ede6-4fc0-b37e-3e56b1f6a401.name: How to Engage the Unmotivated Learner

issuer.summary: issued by National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

alignments.description: List and describe at least two technology tools that can be implemented into the classroom to help promote engagement; Identify the importance of building relationships with students and creating a high-trust, low-stress environment; Name and use multiple strategies that promote student engagement and can be implemented immediately in a course.

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully pass webinar learning assessment with 80% score or higher.

90955b0f-ce25-48e2-91de-027d07bd3e19.description: Join the facilitators of this session for a discussion about being an LGBTQ+ ally on your campus and in your classroom. Learn about the community and how to develop safe spaces for students who identify as LGBTQ+. The session includes information sharing, reflective exercises, and interactive activities to help participants become more informed and effective allies.
90955b0f-ce25-48e2-91de-027d07bd3e19.name: LGBTQ+ Allyship in the Classroom

issuer.summary: issued by National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

entity.name: National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

alignments.name: Learning Outcomes
alignments.description: Participants will articulate personal and professional experiences with the LGBTQ+ community. Participants will describe the LGBTQ+ community and discuss developing safe spaces for students who identify as LGBTQ+. Participants will identify effective strategies to demonstrate allyship towards the LGBTQ+ community.

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully pass webinar learning assessment with 80% score or higher.

c6c5548a-2c52-45bf-8a85-3698a3609cc4.description: With the advent of new technologies that make teaching via live, online (a.k.a. synchronous) sessions easier and more accessible, learning how to facilitate these types of sessions is a critical skill for all educators. Most of us have attended an online class, presentation, or webinar that was just plain boring. During this workshop, participants do some major boredom-busting! Are you ready to create and facilitate sessions that leave your learners wanting more?
c6c5548a-2c52-45bf-8a85-3698a3609cc4.name: No More Boring Online Classes: Creating Exciting, Engaging, and Effective Live Sessions

issuer.summary: issued by National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

entity.name: National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

cae06538-8298-4795-b306-64e6c5e06ae8.description: What if you could visually identify which chapter and Bloom’s taxonomy level your students were struggling with? What if you could use that information to clearly and visually show your students the areas of improvement? This webinar provides tools to help you transform your digital exam and quiz data into a very effective student report. This report not only improves student learning, but also provides a great tool for your own assessment.
cae06538-8298-4795-b306-64e6c5e06ae8.name: Student Reports as Effective Formative Assessment Tools

issuer.summary: issued by National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

entity.name: National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

alignments.name: Learning Outcomes
alignments.description: Identify advanced methods for using data obtained from scantrons or quizzes embedded in most Learning Management Systems; Learn an effective quiz/exam report that students can use for reflection to improve their learning; Learn how to evaluate your own quizzes and exams to improve each question to more accurately assess student learning.

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully pass webinar learning assessment with 80% score or higher.

a995921b-db55-4d0f-851e-4de068e18943.description: During this two-part workshop, participants learn the science behind how stress affects them and actions that can be taken to effectively address it.
a995921b-db55-4d0f-851e-4de068e18943.name: Addressing Faculty Anxiety

907ea289-9ab4-4dcd-8d2a-186b0f503244.description: Millennials are not the younger generation in our classrooms; they’ve been followed by Gen Z students. Students have changed, and so must our classrooms and teaching strategies. Faculty should understand that there are differences between Gen Y and Gen Z students, and that new ways are needed to respond to, communicate with, and motivate Gen Z students. Workshop participants learn how to engage Gen Z students using free and easy-to-use educational technology tools.
907ea289-9ab4-4dcd-8d2a-186b0f503244.name: Another New Paradigm: The MillennialZ and Educational Technology

issuer.summary: issued by National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

entity.name: National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

4b5f0dd7-ca99-4532-a888-32bd85798f1b.description: The facilitator explores how participants of all backgrounds can feel safe engaging in the conversation, bringing their whole selves to work, and making positive changes so everyone in the organization feels valued and included. This workshop helps participants meet important needs that all organizations share: Improving employee inclusion, and mitigating the risk of negative consequences such as decreased employee morale, high turnover rates, and conflict in the workplace.
4b5f0dd7-ca99-4532-a888-32bd85798f1b.name: Another Seat at the Table: A Diversity and Inclusion Workshop

efb350d5-b0a0-4a5a-92b4-75737be7b0e0.name: Building a Culture of Reflection

beb234f2-1497-48f0-9679-2388b55f0ff7.name: Deeper STEM Learning Through Metacognitive Conversations

094cf18e-833f-49a0-9ece-4e0bcbf5a28f.description: This workshop helps new and experienced online instructors understand the features of online practice that contribute to teacher burnout. Participants learn about specific, actionable strategies for reducing their workload without sacrificing student engagement and success.
094cf18e-833f-49a0-9ece-4e0bcbf5a28f.name: Emergence, Not Exhaustion: Sustainable Teaching in Online Environments

issuer.summary: issued by National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

entity.name: National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

1a76e7b3-d7d8-4101-8493-250ddd41fbe3.description: During this multidimensional, highly-interactive, experiential, and fun workshop, participants explore ways to promote positive, enthusiastic, and engaged collaboration among students. They also explore how to encourage student learning in a manner that maximizes motivation, a sense of inclusion, and equity within the learning environment!
1a76e7b3-d7d8-4101-8493-250ddd41fbe3.name: Emotional Intelligence, Student Efficacy, and the Growth Mindset

issuer.summary: issued by National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

entity.name: National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

749dd023-56fe-445e-ac06-de8c60c31dd9.description: Instructors set the tone in the classroom by how they approach their work and students. Through their actions, they communicate their character, credibility, and convictions. Today’s students need to be convinced about their instructor’s passion before they put passion into their own work. To be an effective instructor, you must learn how to connect with your students.
749dd023-56fe-445e-ac06-de8c60c31dd9.name: Everyone Communicates, But Few Connect: Effectively Engaging Today’s Learner

issuer.summary: issued by National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

entity.name: National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

242817ef-4482-402e-a446-e7c7324aa7fa.description: During this two-part workshop, participants practice a series of exercises that can be used in remote teaching to engage students in interactive learning and exploration. The workshop helps faculty build a sense of community within the classroom and emphasizes dialogic approaches to teaching the whole student and engaged learning. Participants gain hands-on experience practicing the exercises and leave the workshop ready to bring new approaches back to the classroom.
242817ef-4482-402e-a446-e7c7324aa7fa.name: Exercise Toolkit for Virtual Interactive Teaching and Learning

issuer.summary: issued by National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

entity.name: National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

3d62dea3-9136-495e-b2c6-71691c0e9a3f.description: During this two-part workshop, participants practice a series of exercises that can be used in remote teaching to engage students in interactive learning and exploration. The workshop helps faculty build a sense of community within the classroom and emphasizes dialogic approaches to teaching the whole student and engaged learning. Participants gain hands-on experience practicing the exercises and leave the workshop ready to bring new approaches back to the classroom.
3d62dea3-9136-495e-b2c6-71691c0e9a3f.name: Exercise Toolkit for Virtual Interactive Teaching and Learning

issuer.summary: issued by National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

entity.name: National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

61e658c4-8bac-4916-b374-6d64327c1b3e.description: When first entering a community college classroom, many faculty members are shocked that students don’t act like “adults.” Even seasoned faculty members are sometimes flabbergasted by students’ behavior. Workshop participants gain a new perspective on student behavior, why students behave in certain ways, and how to respond to unprofessional classroom behavior.
61e658c4-8bac-4916-b374-6d64327c1b3e.name: How to Manage Student Behavior Without Really Trying

issuer.summary: issued by National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

entity.name: National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

07dc8be7-f92d-4942-b8f9-a1e7ec234976.description: Workshop participants examine their own practices and learn what they can do to encourage critical-thinking skills. After watching videos of and participating in hands-on examples of critical-thinking exercises, workshop participants create their own exercises to ensure higher-level critical-thinking skills in their online students. The purpose of this three-part workshop is to expose faculty members to best practices designed to increase students’ critical-thinking skills.
07dc8be7-f92d-4942-b8f9-a1e7ec234976.name: Is There Intelligent Life Online? Searching for Tangible Evidence of Critical-Thinking Skills

issuer.summary: issued by National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

entity.name: National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

94b9e594-4db7-4828-895c-72cbc06bfe5e.description: This badge is given to the facilitator of the NISOD Virtual Workshop "Multiple Pathways to the Student Brain: Science and Strategies to Energize and Enhance Instruction."
94b9e594-4db7-4828-895c-72cbc06bfe5e.name: Multiple Pathways to the Student Brain: Science and Strategies to Energize and Enhance Instruction

issuer.summary: issued by National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

entity.name: National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

3403d0a5-96a1-46e3-b1eb-00b094894cf0.description: This workshop is designed to help educators reach diverse and struggling learners through a deeper understanding of underlying brain processes and science-based strategies based on Dr. Zadina’s book Multiple Pathways to the Student Brain. Participants engage, experience, and laugh while learning how multiple underlying brain pathways can be used for more powerful learning.
3403d0a5-96a1-46e3-b1eb-00b094894cf0.name: Multiple Pathways to the Student Brain: Science and Strategies to Energize and Enhance Instruction

issuer.summary: issued by National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

entity.name: National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

d34478c7-0b22-484c-9945-58e9a24f67bc.description: The recent pandemic has shaken the norms of instructors and students. Instructors have had to rapidly adapt to previously untapped technology that would normally be placed in the “try later” category. This technology is key to establishing new comfort zones in online learning and providing effective instruction to students. This workshop series provides instructional tools that help participants create their desired online or blended learning environment.
d34478c7-0b22-484c-9945-58e9a24f67bc.name: Navigating Through New Instructional Norms

issuer.summary: issued by National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

entity.name: National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

454e7a57-8ddf-413e-af2b-b3187a3a62f7.description: The recent pandemic has shaken the norms of instructors and students. Instructors have had to rapidly adapt to previously untapped technology that would normally be placed in the “try later” category. This technology is key to establishing new comfort zones in online learning and providing effective instruction to students. This workshop series provides instructional tools that help participants create their desired online or blended learning environment.
454e7a57-8ddf-413e-af2b-b3187a3a62f7.name: Navigating Through New Instructional Norms

issuer.summary: issued by National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

entity.name: National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

c8e85eec-6659-42db-aa94-8d0bc9454afb.description: Today’s changing world is influencing how we teach and engage students. It’s more than just moving from a face-to-face to virtual format; our changing world has shifted the entire learning experience. The need to rapidly innovate has never been greater, but finding implementable solutions in a remote environment can be challenging. What if we could co-create a more powerful learning experience by applying innovation tools and techniques used by technology leaders such as Google and Apple?
c8e85eec-6659-42db-aa94-8d0bc9454afb.name: Redesigning the Learning Experience: Empathize, Ideate, and Prototype Like a Pro!

issuer.summary: issued by National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

entity.name: National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

06d0a30d-48a6-40fa-be1e-ae069458c697.description: Today’s changing world is influencing how we teach and engage students. It’s more than just moving from a face-to-face to virtual format; our changing world has shifted the entire learning experience. The need to rapidly innovate has never been greater, but finding implementable solutions in a remote environment can be challenging. What if we could co-create a more powerful learning experience by applying innovation tools and techniques used by technology leaders such as Google and Apple?
06d0a30d-48a6-40fa-be1e-ae069458c697.name: Redesigning the Learning Experience: Empathize, Ideate, and Prototype Like a Pro!

issuer.summary: issued by National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

entity.name: National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

c309b0a2-cf1c-457f-ad07-9437fc5c0a0c.description: This workshop explores a range of innovative scheduling practices and strategies that provide greater clarity, consistency, and stability for students and faculty alike, particularly in times of uncertainty and institutional disruption. At its core, strategic scheduling seeks to bring campus stakeholders together to ensure that students have access to the courses they need for degree completion and advancement.
c309b0a2-cf1c-457f-ad07-9437fc5c0a0c.name: Scheduling for Stability and Growth in Uncertain Times

issuer.summary: issued by National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

entity.name: National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

d2b50aca-8436-4777-b8b5-325765bc293a.description: Badge given to the presenter of the NISOD Virtual Workshop "Scheduling for Stability and Growth in Uncertain Times."
d2b50aca-8436-4777-b8b5-325765bc293a.name: Scheduling for Stability and Growth in Uncertain Times

issuer.summary: issued by National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

entity.name: National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

e26d4cf7-75f0-419b-ba4c-a9d51905f2f0.description: Do you ever feel like you are lost in space in your own classroom, looking for evidence of intelligent life? Workshop participants explore their current practices in the classroom that encourage critical thinking skills. After watching videos of and participating in hands-on examples of critical thinking exercises, workshop participants create their own exercises to ensure higher-level critical thinking among their students.
e26d4cf7-75f0-419b-ba4c-a9d51905f2f0.name: Searching for Tangible Evidence of Critical Thinking Skills

issuer.summary: issued by National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

entity.name: National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

633f3b3a-9cd5-4f5f-a907-4b643e8e32b8.description: This workshop provides participants with concrete tools for teaching rationality and critical thinking skills in Science and Mathematics courses. By the end of the workshop, participants are able to help students be more rational, deploy scientific and mathematical thinking more consistently, and recognize reasoning errors that can be corrected with scientific and mathematical reasoning. Instructors will understand rationality, mindware, gaps in mindware, and recognize contaminated mindware.
633f3b3a-9cd5-4f5f-a907-4b643e8e32b8.name: Teaching Critical Thinking and Rationality in Science and Math Courses

issuer.summary: issued by National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

entity.name: National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

911971ce-2664-4887-bfad-98d5afef03de.description: This workshop provides participants with specific tools for teaching critical thinking skills in pre-college English courses. The facilitator provides proven methodologies to enhance critical thinking skills while teaching basic English writing and comprehension. By the end of the workshop, participants can better prepare students for transfer-level English courses and increase their critical thinking skills.
911971ce-2664-4887-bfad-98d5afef03de.name: Teaching Critical Thinking in Pre-College English Courses

issuer.summary: issued by National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

entity.name: National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

62ad50c7-8e78-42b0-81f6-80b080e92903.description: This workshop provides participants with specific tools they can use to teach critical-thinking skills in an online environment. An emphasis is placed on using the tools in Humanities and Social Sciences classes to improve students’ reading and writing skills.
62ad50c7-8e78-42b0-81f6-80b080e92903.name: Teaching Critical Thinking Online

issuer.summary: issued by National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

entity.name: National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

31b30a42-a65f-4d58-9db2-e8cbd02ec431.description: This series of three interactive Teachin’ It! modules offers practical strategies for delivering high-quality online instruction that disrupts larger systemic inequities at the classroom level. Participants receive strategies they can use to foster an online classroom where students from every background feel safe to experiment, take risks, and make mistakes; invited to communicate their unique approaches and perspectives; and free to develop their own identities as powerful lifelong learners.
31b30a42-a65f-4d58-9db2-e8cbd02ec431.name: Teachin’ It! Tips to Facilitate Inclusive, Inquiry-Based Learning Online

issuer.summary: issued by National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

entity.name: National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

9d2afd29-0014-4b62-9d95-28f3607cf5e8.description: This series of three interactive Teachin’ It! modules offers practical strategies for delivering high-quality online instruction that disrupts larger systemic inequities at the classroom level. Participants receive strategies they can use to foster an online classroom where students from every background feel safe to experiment, take risks, and make mistakes; invited to communicate their unique approaches and perspectives; and free to develop their own identities as powerful lifelong learners.
9d2afd29-0014-4b62-9d95-28f3607cf5e8.name: Teachin’ It! Tips to Facilitate Inclusive, Inquiry-Based Learning Online

issuer.summary: issued by National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

entity.name: National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

ffd0dc61-1b4d-4563-a051-bb9b5416b1af.description: Mental health issues are becoming a crisis in education due to the effects of the pandemic. In addition to impairing physical health, anxiety, stress, and trauma make it harder for students to do higher-order thinking, focus, regulate emotions, get to class, budget time, and complete projects. But you can help! Workshop participants learn how to reduce these obstacles to achievement, whether they’re teaching in-person or online.
ffd0dc61-1b4d-4563-a051-bb9b5416b1af.name: The Hidden Learning Disability of Anxiety, Stress, and Trauma: Science and Strategies for Improved Learning

issuer.summary: issued by National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development

entity.name: National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development
